Others: The Orlando Magic made a season-high 19 shots from beyond the arc in a 106-97 win against the Toronto Raptors.
The Magic made nearly half of their three-point shots in the first quarter alone.
Orlando made 13 three-pointers in the first half, setting a franchise record.
The Raptors struggled defensively, allowing the Magic to shoot 43.2% from three-point range.
Starting centre Jakob Poeltl noted that the Raptors made undisciplined mistakes and messed up some scouting report stuff.
Forward Ochai Agbaji agreed with his coach, noting that he and his teammates just weren't aggressive enough.
The two teams were evenly matched on field goal attempts, but the Magic took more three-point attempts and made a higher percentage of them.
Orlando did it all largely without star guard Jalen Suggs who left the game with back spasms.
